policy_type: Home Insurance - Household Buildings and Contents Insurance
coverage_summary: Household Buildings and Contents Insurance designed to provide cover for loss or damage to your property, including main coverage for perils like fire, theft, flood, and storm, with optional covers for accidental damage, home assistance, legal protection, and personal possessions.
key_inclusions: Loss or damage from fire, smoke, explosion, lightning, earthquake, storm, flood, theft
Escape of water (e.g. burst pipes or tanks), oil, malicious acts, riot, subsidence
Collision by vehicles or animals, falling trees, collapse of aerials or satellite dishes
Valuables up to £30,000 per claim (single items up to £15,000)
Alternative accommodation up to £200,000 for Buildings and £15,000 for Contents
Contents in garages and outbuildings up to £100,000
Contents in the garden up to £1,000
Visitors and domestic staff personal effects £1,000
Liability to domestic staff up to £10,000,000
Occupiers and public liability up to £2,000,000
Accidental damage to entertainment equipment up to £100,000
Accidental breakage of mirrors, fixed glass in furniture, ceramic hobs and glass oven doors up to £100,000
Accidental damage to cables, drain inspection covers and underground drains, pipes or tanks up to £1,000,000
Accidental breakage of fixed glass in windows, fixed ceramic hobs and fixed sanitary ware and bathroom fittings up to £1,000,000
Emergency evacuation alternative accommodation up to £2,500
key_exclusions: Loss or damage caused gradually or by wear and tear, depreciation
Effects of light or atmosphere, mould, dry or wet rot or fungus
Costs from normal use, maintenance and upkeep of buildings
Loss or damage after home has been unoccupied or unfurnished - by theft, malicious people, and escape of water or oil
Loss or damage to gates, hedges and fences caused by storm or flood
Loss or damage caused by sinks and baths overflowing from taps being left on (unless accidental damage cover added)
Loss or damage caused deliberately, wilfully, maliciously, illegally or unlawfully by you, your family or anyone lawfully in the home
Mechanical or electrical breakdown or failure (contents accidental damage)
Damage to jewellery when moving house
Damage when items placed into storage during house move
Damage caused by or during cleaning, maintenance, repair, dismantling, restoring, altering, dyeing or washing
Damage from faulty workmanship, defective design or defective materials (buildings accidental damage)
Damage caused by alteration or extension of buildings

sub_limits.home_assistance_per_claim: £1,000 inc VAT (for callout and temporary repair)

special_conditions: You and your family must take precautions to avoid injury, loss or damage
Take reasonable steps to safeguard the property insured from loss or damage
For Home Assistance: property should be properly maintained and boiler/heating system serviced by qualified person per manufacturer's guidelines
For Personal Possessions: theft from unattended vehicles only covered if items hidden in boot/glovebox and vehicle fully locked
Must notify of changes including: change of address, structural alterations, letting the home, unoccupied periods, bankruptcy, criminal convictions or cautions
Premium must be paid on time
Must not dispose of damaged items or conduct permanent repairs before inspection
excess_deductible: You will need to pay an amount of each claim, known as the excess. All excess amounts are listed in your policy schedule. These amounts may vary depending on your voluntary excess choices.
geographical_coverage: Private residences in The United Kingdom. Optional Family Legal Protection: Claims arising or where proceedings brought in The United Kingdom, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and the European Union. Personal Possessions: Anywhere in the world.
age_restrictions: Home Assistance: Boilers over 15 years old are excluded from the optional cover
cancellation_policy: Can cancel within 14 days of receipt of policy documents (cooling-off period). If cover has not started, full refund. If cover has started, pro-rata refund provided no claims occurred. Can cancel anytime with written notice - pro-rata refund as long as no claims incurred during coverage period. If any claims made, no refund of premium.

endorsements.name: Home Assistance
endorsements.description: Provides up to £1,000 inc VAT for callout and temporary repair charges for plumbing issues (leaking pipes, blocked drains, leaking radiators), toilet blockages, central heating/boiler failure, total electricity failure, pests (wasps, squirrels, rats, mice), and broken/damaged windows, doors & locks presenting security risk. Includes £250 alternative accommodation.
endorsements.coverage_impact: Adds emergency home repair cover. Excludes: LPG/oil/solid fuel/renewable heating, unvented systems, boilers over 60 Kw/hr or 15+ years old, replacement of external overflows/cylinders/tanks/radiators/sanitary ware, detached outbuildings/garages, unserviced boilers, beyond economical repair boilers, pests outside main dwelling, descaling/power flushing/sludge damage, routine maintenance. Limit 3 claims per 12 months. Underwritten by Inter Partner Assistance S.A.

endorsements.name: Family Legal Protection
endorsements.description: Covers legal advisers' costs for: breach of contract disputes (buying/renting goods/services), personal injury compensation claims, employment tribunal/court action, nuisance/trespassing claims, property damage claims, defending motoring prosecutions, defending breach of contract claims when selling goods, accountancy fees for HMRC Full Enquiry, and Data Protection breach claims.
endorsements.coverage_impact: Adds legal expense cover. Excludes: claims without prospects of success (less than 51% likelihood of winning), where advisers' costs exceed amount in dispute, pre-inception incidents, disputes under £125 plus VAT, conflicts with other insured persons, costs covered by other policies, non-approved costs, own legal representative costs exceeding standard rates. 90-day qualifying period for Employment claims, 180-day period for Property Infringement. Provided by Arc Legal Assistance Limited.

endorsements.name: Additional Accidental Damage to Contents
endorsements.description: Covers accidental damage or loss to contents in the home up to the contents sum insured (including house removal by professional contractors to any new private residence in UK, Channel Islands or Isle of Man). Covers up to £1,000 for accidental damage to contents in the garden.
endorsements.coverage_impact: Extends base cover to include accidental damage. Excludes: mechanical/electrical breakdown, jewellery when moving, items in storage during house move, damage from cleaning/maintenance/repair/dismantling/restoring/altering/dyeing/washing. Includes cover for sinks/baths overflowing from taps left on.

endorsements.name: Additional Accidental Damage to Buildings
endorsements.description: Covers accidental damage or loss to buildings up to the buildings sum insured.
endorsements.coverage_impact: Extends base cover to include accidental damage to buildings. Excludes: damage from faulty workmanship/defective design/defective materials, damage from alteration or extension of buildings.

endorsements.name: Personal Possessions anywhere in the world
endorsements.description: Covers loss or damage to personal effects, valuables and money belonging to you and your family anywhere in the world. Provides up to £1,000 credit card liability (theft or unauthorised use).
endorsements.coverage_impact: Adds worldwide cover for items carried outside the home. Excludes: items not in care/custody/control of you, family or authorised person, theft from unattended vehicles unless items hidden in boot/glovebox and vehicle fully secured.

claims_requirements.notification_timeframe: As soon as possible. For Family Legal Protection: notify within 180 days of becoming aware of the insured incident. For Home Assistance: call as soon as aware of the home emergency.
required_documents: All relevant information about the claim
For Home Assistance: relevant identification including boiler service receipts on demand
Information to assist in validating the claim
For Family Legal Protection: all information required to decide whether claim may be accepted (at your own expense)
process_steps: Provide all relevant information about the claim to assist in validation
Take steps to prevent further damage
Do not dispose of damaged items
Do not conduct permanent repairs (insurer may need to inspect damage)
For Family Legal Protection: gain consent before incurring legal advisers' costs
For Home Assistance: produce identification and boiler service receipts to contractor
Cooperate in obtaining reimbursement from third parties where applicable
claims_requirements.evidence_requirements: Must not dispose of damaged items or conduct permanent repairs as insurer may need to inspect the damage. For Home Assistance: boiler service receipts required.
claims_requirements.claims_contact: Contact details not specified in this IPID document - refer to full policy documents

eligibility_criteria.occupational_restrictions: Must be for private residential purposes only - must notify if used for any other reason
eligibility_criteria.residency_requirements: Private residences in The United Kingdom
other_restrictions: Must not be bankrupt or received police caution/conviction/charge for offences (must notify if occurs)
Property must not be unoccupied or unfurnished for extended periods without notification
Must not let the home without notification
Property must be maintained in good repair
For Home Assistance optional cover: boiler/heating system must be serviced within past year

policy_definitions.unoccupied: See policy booklet for specific definition - relates to exclusion of theft, malicious damage and escape of water/oil when home is unoccupied
policy_definitions.unfurnished: See policy booklet for specific definition - relates to exclusion of theft, malicious damage and escape of water/oil when home is unfurnished
policy_definitions.valuables: Items subject to £30,000 per claim limit and £15,000 per item limit
policy_definitions.family: Persons whose personal effects are covered under the policy
policy_definitions.business equipment: Equipment used for business purposes, covered up to £5,000
policy_definitions.temporary removal: Contents temporarily removed from the home, covered up to £100,000
policy_definitions.personal possessions: Personal effects, valuables and money belonging to you and your family (for worldwide optional cover)
policy_definitions.prospects_of_success: Likelihood of winning legal action must be 51% or greater (for Family Legal Protection)
policy_definitions.home_emergency: Events covered under Home Assistance including plumbing issues, heating failure, electrical failure, pests, security breaches

time_sensitive_requirements.waiting_periods: Family Legal Protection: 90 day qualifying period for Employment claims, 180 day qualifying period for Property Infringement claims
time_sensitive_requirements.notification_deadlines: Family Legal Protection: must notify within 180 days of becoming aware of insured incident. Home Assistance: call as soon as aware of emergency
time_sensitive_requirements.claims_deadlines: Notify claims as soon as possible once aware of incident
time_sensitive_requirements.cooling_off_period: 14 days from receipt of policy documents for cancellation with full or pro-rata refund (if no claims)

common_questions.question: What happens if my home is left empty?
common_questions.answer: Loss or damage occurring after the home has been unoccupied or unfurnished is not covered for theft, malicious people and escape of water or oil. You must notify the insurer if your home will be unoccupied.

common_questions.question: Are my belongings covered if I take them with me on holiday?
common_questions.answer: Base policy includes temporary removal up to £100,000. For worldwide cover of personal possessions, you need to add the optional Personal Possessions cover which provides worldwide protection for personal effects, valuables and money.
common_questions.section_reference: What is insured - Temporary removal; Optional Personal Possessions cover

common_questions.question: What if my bath overflows because I left the taps on?
common_questions.answer: This is not covered under the base policy unless you purchase the additional accidental damage to contents cover.

common_questions.question: Does the policy cover my garden fence if damaged in a storm?
common_questions.answer: No, loss or damage to gates, hedges and fences caused by storm or flood is specifically excluded.

common_questions.question: Can I cancel my policy after the 14 day cooling off period?
common_questions.answer: Yes, you can cancel at any time with written notice. You'll receive a pro-rata refund as long as you haven't incurred claims during the coverage period. If claims have been made, no refund is provided.
common_questions.section_reference: How do I cancel the contract - page 3

common_questions.question: Is my boiler covered if it breaks down?
common_questions.answer: The base policy does not cover mechanical/electrical breakdown. However, the optional Home Assistance cover provides up to £1,000 for boiler failure callout and temporary repairs, subject to conditions including the boiler being under 15 years old and serviced within the past year.

common_questions.question: What is the maximum I can claim for a single valuable item like jewelry?
common_questions.answer: Any one valuable item is covered up to £15,000, with total valuables per claim up to £30,000.

common_questions.question: Am I covered if I accidentally damage my TV?
common_questions.answer: Yes, accidental damage to entertainment equipment is covered up to £100,000 under the base policy.

common_questions.question: What if I need to stay elsewhere while my home is being repaired after damage?
common_questions.answer: Alternative accommodation is covered up to £200,000 for Buildings claims and up to £15,000 for Contents claims. There's also emergency evacuation alternative accommodation up to £2,500.

common_questions.question: Does wear and tear damage get covered?
common_questions.answer: No, any loss or damage caused gradually or by wear and tear, depreciation, effects of light or atmosphere, mould, dry or wet rot or fungus, and costs from normal use, maintenance and upkeep are excluded.

common_questions.question: How long do I have to report a legal issue under the Family Legal Protection?
common_questions.answer: You must notify claims as soon as possible once you become aware of the insured incident and within no more than 180 days of becoming aware.
common_questions.section_reference: What are my obligations - Family Legal Protection, page 3

common_questions.question: Can I use my own solicitor for a legal claim?
common_questions.answer: Once court proceedings are issued or if a conflict of interest arises, you can use your own legal representative, but the insurer won't cover any costs exceeding their standard advisers' rates.
common_questions.section_reference: Are there any restrictions on cover - Family Legal Protection, page 2
